alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 12:28PM EST until March 14 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Vincennes. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River at Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Montezuma, and Mount Carmel. East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Hazleton and Petersburg. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue on the White, East Fork White, and Wabash Rivers. River flood stages are expected to rise again in the next few days as additional rainfall is expected tonight and tomorrow. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is currently forecast to last through much of the week, but could be extended based on expected rainfall over the next few days. Additional portions of these and other waterways not currently in flood may return to flood conditions early this week based on this expected rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, MARCH 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site. * WHEN...Until Monday, March 14. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Seep water occurs behind levees on Indiana side. Hutson Creek begins to overflow from backwater. Old Darwin Road and a few rural roads in eastern Clark and Crawford counties in Illinois are impassable. Low agricultural land floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river will fall to 16.4 feet and then begin rising early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise again to 17.0 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1130 PM CST /1230 AM EST/.
